section.name: Introduction
section.p: Loom 1.0 is based on the (unreleased) Phoenix 4.1 codebase, and has several enhancements over the Phoenix 4.0.x releases.

The main difference between the Phoenix 4.0.x and Loom 1.0 distributions is that some of the libraries in the lib/ directory have been removed in Loom as they are not used by the container. If your app uses any of the excluded libraries, you simply need to bundle them with the sar.
Apart from library changes to the sar, you need not make any further change. Loom 1.0 is a drop-in replacement for Phoenix 4.0.x.

section.name: Library difference
section.p:
Phoenix 4.0.x ships the following libraries:
avalon-framework excalibur-baxter excalibur-cli excalibur-collections excalibur-concurrent excalibur-configuration excalibur-containerkit excalibur-extension excalibur-i18n excalibur-instrument excalibur-io excalibur-logger excalibur-pool excalibur-thread excalibur-threadcontext excalibur-util isorelax.jar jing.jar logkit phoenix-client xalan xercesImpl xml-apis

Loom 1.0 comes with a much leaner set of libraries:
avalon-framework excalibur-instrument logkit log4j mx4j-jmx phoenix-client
